snippet: At a time when many airline “innovations” — like charging extra for an aisle seat or cutting back on frequent flier benefits — might anger more than amaze, carriers like Virgin Atlantic and Qantas are using wearable devices and other...
abstract: At a time when many airline “innovations” — like charging extra for an aisle seat or cutting back on frequent flier benefits — might anger more than amaze, carriers like Virgin Atlantic and Qantas are using wearable devices and other technology to get closer to their customers.

headline.main: Daily Report: Airlines Use Wearables to Get More Personal
